text.0: indra and agni surely ye as conquerors will give us wealth.
text.1: whereby in fight we may oercome that which is strong and firmly fixed as agni burns the woods with wind let all the others die away.
text.2: we set no snares to tangle you indra we worship and adore hero of heroes mightiest.
text.3: once may he come unto us with his steed come unto us to win us strength and to complete the sacrifice.
text.4: for famous indraagni ye are dwellers in the midst of frays.
text.5: sages in wisdom ye are knit to him who seeketh you as friends heroes bestow on him his wish.
text.6: nabhākalike with sacred song indras and agnis praise i sing.
text.7: theirs to whom all this world belongs this heaven and this mighty earth which bear rich treasure in their lap.
text.8: to indra and to agni send your prayers as was nabhākas wont.
text.9: who oped with sideway opening the sea with its foundations sevenindra all powerful in his might.
text.10: tear thou asunder as of old like tangles of a creeping plant.
text.11: demolish thou the dāsas might may we with indras help divide the treasure he hath gathered up.
text.12: what time with this same song these men call indraagni sundry ways.
text.13: may we with our own heroes quell those who provoke us to the fight and conquer those who strive with us.
text.14: the two refulgent with their beams rise and come downward from the sky.
text.15: by indras and by agnis hest flowing away the rivers run which they released from their restraint.
text.16: o indra many are thine aids many thy ways of guiding us.
text.17: lord of the bay steeds hinvas son to a good hero come our prayers which soon shall have accomplishment.
text.18: inspire him with your holy hymns the hero bright and glorious.
text.19: him who with might demolisheth even the brood of Śuṣṇa and winneth for us the heavenly streams.
text.20: inspire him worshipped with fair rites the glorious hero truly brave.
text.21: he brake in pieces Śuṣṇas brood who still expected not the stroke and won for us the heavenly streams let all the others die away.
text.22: thus have we sung anew to indraagni as sang our sires aṅgirases and mandhātar.
text.23: guard us with triple shelter and preserve us may we be masters of a store of riches.
